Author: arilupe

Comment: Voice of America, as I understand, is largely directed at foreign audiences, promoting narratives critical of government and promoting more press freedom in places where it's severely curtailed... so it is already reflective of some bias (as all journalism necessarily is). Ironically, one of the mainstays of the propagandistic aspect of VoA is how it demonstrates (or demonstrated?) American press freedom.  I'm just wondering what in the hell OAN has to say to Uzbeks, Laotians, Macedonians, Ethiopians... could OAN staff even pick these places out on a map, let alone craft some version of their screed that has any relevance to the disparate political and cultural environments and realities in which VoA operates?
